channel.title: Inductance Cancellation on SUPER-Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Inductance Cancellation on SUPER-Lab

item.title: Inductance cancellation in RF resonant power converters
item.description: Parasitic inductance cancellation is employed in order to operate a resonant power inverter at 27.12 MHz using a TO-220 through-hole package.The elimination of parasitic inductances allows for system cost reduction, increased power handling, and/or relaxation of PCB layout constraints. The inductance cancellation technique is demonstrated through two prototypes (based upon the same silicon MOSFET die) providing 60 W of RF power to a 50 Î© load from a 48 V DC input.
